bibl.title: Letter from Frank R. McCoy to Philip Showalter Hench, February 16, 1948

div1.p: McCoy questions Hench about his book on Reed and yellow fever. He is looking forward to meeting with Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Frank R. McCoy to Philip Showalter Hench, February 16, 1948

opener.dateline:
FAR EASTERN COMMISSION
2516 MASSACHUSETTS AVENUE, N. W.
WASHINGTON 8, D. C.
Republic 5600 - Ext. 3141
February 16, 1948

div1.p:
I am very much interested in hearing from
you and hearing about you and your prospective
book on Walter Reed. I shall be glad to discuss
the point in question and try to refresh my memory
before seeing you. That will be agreeable for me
any time on Thursday afternoon here at the office
of the Far Eastern Commission. I shall be unable
to see you Thursday morning on account of the meet-
ing of the Commission, but if you will telephone
me Wednesday or Thursday I shall be glad to arrange
to see you on Thursday afternoon at your convenience.
I note that you are leaving that day, so that it may
be more agreeable for you to arrange as early as we
can to get together after lunch.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Frank McCoy Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayflower Hotel
Washington, D. C.
